techmeme.title: Over 1,000 musicians, including Kate Bush, "co-write" a "silent" album to protest a UK proposal letting AI train on their copyrighted work if they don't opt out (Dan Milmo/The Guardian)
Epic v. Apple: Phil Schiller says he initially feared Apple's 27% App Store fee posed a compliance risk and could create "antagonistic" developer relations (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Sources: Trump's team plans tougher US chip curbs and have met with Dutch and Japanese counterparts, urging them to tighten restrictions on China's chip sector (Bloomberg)
Claude 3.7 and Grok 3 are the first Gen3 AI models with big gains in handling complex tasks, using 10x more compute than GPT-4-class models and better reasoning (Ethan Mollick/One Useful Thing)
Sources: SpaceX seeks to deploy Starlink terminals for the FAA, raising questions about Musk's conflicts of interest and a $2B FAA contract Verizon won in 2023 (Bloomberg)
